prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. [caption] The blade is red with blood, while the handle with the butterfly motif is completely clean. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Edgeworth:
Take a good look at these documents, Franziska.
Franziska:
It says that there are three pages in total, and yet, there are only two here.
Edgeworth:
Correct. Now take a look at the smuggling activity document in your possession. Tell me, is it not possible that your page was taken from this set of three?
Franziska:
Well, well... It certainly looks that way.
Edgeworth:
By putting our multi-part puzzle together, we seem to have arrived at an answer. And it seems that you have now found what you were looking for.
Franziska:
Yes, and with this, it has become crystal clear... ...that Mr. Coachen himself was responsible for the mass smuggling of Babahlese ink!
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Even your police confirmed that the Yatagarasu infiltrated the Babahlese embassy tonight.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 1
Testimony: Utilizing the confusion caused by the fire, the Yatagarasu snuck into this embassy.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 2
Testimony: Furthermore, this girl claims to be the Yatagarasu.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 3
Testimony: She wanted to steal documents regarding smuggling, so she killed Mr. Coachen for the key.
Person: Shih-na
Testimony 4
Testimony: And most importantly, other than her, there was no one else in here with the body.
Person: Shih-na

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony provided.

First, looking at the testimonies from Shih-na (Testimonies 0-4). She claims that the Yatagarasu infiltrated the Babahlese embassy, used the fire as cover, and that Kay Faraday is the Yatagarasu who killed Coachen for a key, and that no one else was there with the body.

Now, let's check the evidence. Evidence 24 mentions a photo of Yatagarasu taken during the fire, but it notes that the photo was taken after the first fires on the 4th and 5th floors. If the Yatagarasu was supposed to have infiltrated during the fire, but the photo was taken after those fires started, maybe there's a timing issue here. Wait, but Testimony 1 says the Yatagarasu used the confusion of the fire to get in. If the photo was taken during the fire, that might align, but maybe there's a contradiction elsewhere.

Looking at Evidence 26, it states that two fires broke out in Babahl. Testimony 1 mentions the Yatagarasu using the confusion from the fire. But if there were two fires, maybe the timing or the number of fires is conflicting?

Wait, maybe Evidence 25, the Fires in Babahl (26) says two fires occurred. Testimony 1 says the Yatagarasu used the confusion from the fire (singular). So if there were two fires, maybe that contradicts the testimony's mention of a single fire? Hmm, but maybe not directly. Let me think again.

Looking at Testimony 3: "She wanted to steal documents regarding smuggling, so she killed Mr. Coachen for the key." The key here might refer to Evidence 4, Yatagarasu's Key, which was stolen 7 years ago. But Evidence 11 is DeMasque II's Note requesting the Primidux Statue theft, which was linked to Coachen. Maybe that's a different angle.

Wait, Evidence 31 is the Trump Card from KG-8, which shows orders from the smuggling ring boss to Coachen. And Evidence 32 is the Video Tape showing Coachen at the KG-8 scene. If Coachen was part of the smuggling ring, maybe his death was related to that, contradicting Shih-na's claim that Kay killed him for the key?

Alternatively, Evidence 33 is the Counterfeit Plate found in the fake Primidux Statue. If the statue was part of the smuggling, maybe that's connected. But I'm not sure yet.

Another angle: Testimony 4 says "no one else was in here with the body." But Evidence 37, the Pushcart, mentions blood inside and that Steel Samurai pushed it. If Larry Butz (Steel Samurai) was involved, that could mean someone else was present, contradicting Testimony 4's assertion that only Kay was there.

Wait, Testimony 4 says "other than her, there was no one else in here with the body." If the Pushcart was moved by Steel Samurai (Larry), that implies Larry was there, so that would contradict Testimony 4. But I need to check if the Pushcart's evidence directly relates to someone else being present. Evidence 37 says the pushcart was pushed from the dressing room to Allebahst, and there's blood inside. If Larry was involved in moving it, that would place him at the scene, conflicting with Testimony 4's claim that only Kay was there.

Alternatively, Evidence 35, the Commemorative Photo, shows the murder weapon in Alba's bouquet. If Alba used that weapon, maybe he's the culprit, contradicting Shih-na's testimony about Kay.

Wait, but Shih-na's Testimony 3 specifically says Kay killed Coachen for the key. If Evidence 35 shows Alba had the weapon, maybe Alba is the killer, so that would contradict Shih-na's testimony.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 34, Amb. Alba's Wound is claimed to be from DeMasque II, but if the photo (Evidence 35) shows the weapon in his bouquet, maybe he used it on himself or someone else.

Hmm, this is a bit tangled. Let me refocus on each testimony and evidence.

Testimony 3 says Kay killed Coachen for a key related to smuggling documents. Evidence 11 (DeMasque II's Note) links Coachen to the Primidux Statue theft, which might be part of smuggling. But maybe the key in the testimony refers to the Yatagarasu's Key (Evidence4), but that was from 7 years ago. Alternatively, the key to the documents? But Evidence 31 and 32 suggest Coachen was part of the smuggling ring, so perhaps he was killed by someone else in the ring, not Kay. That would contradict Shih-na's testimony.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: Shih-na says the Yatagarasu infiltrated Babahlese embassy. But Evidence 6 states the Babahl's Primidux Statue was swapped with a fake from Babahl, which might mean the real was taken from Allebahst. If the Yatagarasu was after the real one, maybe the embassy involved was Allebahst, not Babahlese. That could be a contradiction.

Wait, Evidence 6 says the real Primidux is originally from Allebahst. The note in Evidence 11 (DeMasque II's Note) requests stealing the Primidux Statue, which is in Babahl's office. If the Yatagarasu was after the real one, which was in Babahl, but the real one was swapped, maybe the Yatagarasu took the fake. Hmm, not sure.

Alternatively, Testimony 1 says the Yatagarasu used the fire's confusion. Evidence 25's photo was taken after the first fires on 4th and 5th floors. If the Yatagarasu's entry was during the fire, but the photo was taken after those fires started, maybe timing is off. But that might not be a direct contradiction.

Looking back at Testimony 4: "no one else was there with the body." Evidence 37's Pushcart was moved by Steel Samurai (Larry Butz), implying Larry was present. So if the Pushcart's presence or movement requires someone else's involvement, that contradicts Testimony 4's claim that only Kay was there.

Alternatively, Evidence 30: the Hair Sticks are actually crossbow arrows. If someone else used those arrows, that would implicate another person, contradicting Testimony 4.

Alternatively, Evidence 29: the Revolving Fireplace Wall in Babahl was used. If the fireplace wall connects to Allebahst, maybe someone used it to move in/out, implying others were present.

Hmm, perhaps the strongest contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 37. If the Pushcart was moved by Larry (Steel Samurai), then he was present, contradicting Testimony 4's statement that only Kay was there. But I need to confirm if Evidence 37 directly states that someone else was there. The description says Steel Samurai pushed it, so that would mean Larry was present, hence contradicting Testimony 4.

Alternatively, Testimony 3 mentions Kay killed Coachen for the key. Evidence 5's knife has a butterfly motif, which is Allebahstian. If the murder weapon was from Allebahst, maybe the killer was from there, like Amb. Alba, contradicting Kay's involvement.

Wait, Evidence 35's Commemorative Photo shows the murder weapon in Alba's bouquet. If he had it, he might have used it, making him the killer, which contradicts Shih-na's testimony that Kay did it. That could be a contradiction between Evidence 35 and Testimony 3.

Alternatively, Evidence 34 says Amb. Alba's wound is from DeMasque II, but if the murder weapon was in his bouquet (Evidence 35), maybe he used it on Coachen, making him the killer instead of Kay. So Testimony 3 (Kay did it) vs. Evidence 35 (Alba had the weapon, implying he could be the killer) would be a contradiction.

Alternatively, Evidence 33 is a counterfeit plate in the fake statue. If Coachen was involved in smuggling counterfeit items, maybe his death was due to that, not Kay's actions.

Hmm, this is a bit complex, but I think the strongest contradiction is between Testimony 4 (only Kay was there) and Evidence 37 (Steel Samurai/Larry was present via the Pushcart). Let me check the evidence again:

Evidence 37: "Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside."

So if the Steel Samurai (Larry) pushed the cart, he was present at the scene, which would mean there was someone else (Larry) with the body, contradicting Testimony 4's claim that "no one else was in here with the body" besides Kay.

Therefore, the contradiction is Evidence 37 and Testimony 4.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each piece of evidence and testimony provided.

First, looking at the testimonies from Shih-na. Testimony 0 says the knife wound matches the blade of the knife with the butterfly handle. Testimony 1 states that the butterfly handle knife is the murder weapon, and the killer was holding it. Testimony 2 assumes the girl got the knife from the display rack. Testimony 3 mentions the knife is part of a 3-piece set with a unique design. Testimony 4 concludes that all evidence points to the girl.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 5 describes the knife: it's covered in blood, has a butterfly handle, and is one of three ornamental knives. The blade is Allebahstian. However, there's a note that the handle was swapped with a Babahlese one, and the real blade is missing. Evidence 8 is the Babahlese knife handle, which was swapped, and the real blade isn't found. 

Wait, so according to Evidence 5 and 8, the murder weapon's handle was swapped. The actual blade used might not be the one with the butterfly handle. Shih-na's testimony (Testimony 1 and 3) claims the butterfly handle knife is the murder weapon. But if the handle was swapped, then the actual blade might be from another knife. The blade that caused the wound might not match the butterfly handle knife's blade. 

Evidence 5 says the blade is Allebahstian, but the handle is Babahlese. If the killer used a different blade (since the handle was swapped), then the wound might not match the displayed knife. So Shih-na's testimony that the wound matches the butterfly knife's blade (Testimony 0 and 1) contradicts the evidence that the handle was swapped and the blade is from another. 

Alternatively, maybe the swapped handle means the displayed knife isn't the actual murder weapon. So the testimony assumes the butterfly knife is the murder weapon, but the evidence shows that the actual blade used was part of another set, hence the wound might not match. Therefore, Evidence 5 and Testimony 0 or 1 would contradict. Let me check the exact wording again.

Evidence 5 says the blade matches the wound. Wait, no, Evidence 5 says "blade matches the wound" but also mentions the handle was swapped. Wait, the description says: "Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. [...] Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found."

Wait, maybe I misread. Let me re-express Evidence 5's description: The knife has a butterfly handle but the blade is Allebahstian. The blade matches the wound. However, the handle was swapped with the Babahlese one. The real murder weapon's handle was Babahlese, but the blade (Allebahstian) is the one found. prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. [caption] The blade is red with blood, while the handle with the butterfly motif is completely clean. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was the one who found the body of the victim, DeMasque II.
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: Beside him was the Samurai Sword... glittering red, and offering up the scent of blood.
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: Beside him was the Samurai Sword... covered in the victim's blood.
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: I suspect he beat the victim to death with that thing.
Person: Lang
Testimony 4
Testimony: It was supposed to be in the Steel Samurai's dressing room, but I found it here instead.
Person: Lang
Testimony 5
Testimony: Plus, I found the murder weapon's owner, the suspect, Larry Butz in here, too.
Person: Lang

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
